title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
lol yeah I posted there cos I thought that was the main CK forums - it obviously wasnt :P

That poster is the one that was dumped on flikr from a description of the armageddon machine I gave him. I gave him a copy of the game last night and is currently revamping to make it faithful to the one in the game.

Thanks for the hosting offer TMST [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I think for the moment Flickr will do, however feel free to grab it from there. Until I have a definate green-light I feel there is little point in going overboard and getting everyones hopes up.

Exams have just started here at uni, I will of course keep you updated during them, but no work will be commenced on the film during this 3 week period

Regards,

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
to be honest i think its just a prankster. I really doubt anyone has the time or money to make a keen movie.

I'll belive it when i see it. We've had many people say many insteresting things on this forum, and only a few of them ever actually were true.

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]alex: to be honest i think its just a prankster. I really doubt anyone has the time or money to make a keen movie.[hr][/quote]

True, although most of those people say things like "OMFG!!!1 im making teh keens movy!!!!!!11" and never have any intention of creating a Keen movie.

Mat seems a little too articulate to be one of those folk. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

In what I've read from his posts, he seems to know what he's talking about and has the capabilities to pull off a Keen movie.

I'm not going to make a comment on whether he'll complete the movie - that's not for me to call. But whatever happens, he's got my interest in it.

Edit: Gargdamn ezcode screwed up...

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
Yeah i mean dont get me wrong, i'd love to see a keen movie, i think that would rock. If he can at least make us like a trailer then that would make it alot more belivable in my opinion. So yeah.

Another thing you gotta remember is movies are just somthing you 'make' it takes alot of time and effort to make not only a rpofessional movie, but one that will actually be *good*.

Theres only one movie that i know of that was done on a very short time scale and turned out good, and thats Disneys Aladdin.

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
Just out of curiosity, have you seen the [url=http://www.newvoyages.com/]fan-made episodes of Star Trek[/url]? Are you expecting your film to turn out better or worse than those?

For those who haven't seen them (and don't want to download them), they're pretty good considering they were made by fans of the show (and I hate to criticise because of the effort they went to), but at the same time it is very obvious that it's not being done by professionals, and that does make it a little difficult at times to become 'immersed' in the storyline.

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?

If it is Commander Keen, and people can tell you put a lot of work into it, they will appreciate it.

title: Re: Keen Movie!- Will they succeed?
content:
ive seen a few of them, and that other one 'the pirkinning'. They were excellent fan creations, however there is a large difference in what we are trying to achieve with CKGG

Those fan-movies are deliberate in cloning the star trek universe, we are not planning on doing that with any existing universe. We are going to do something of our own. A lot of what the movie is about is centered on keen, how he is and his relationship with other people. The role of 'Commander Keen' is a way of expressing his irritation with others in not understanding his genius. I dont want to give too much away about the plot, but we want to create a more 'human' film than 'this is a fan movie, look at the effects'. That is not to say we wont have explosions, space-ships and planets being invaded though! A LOT of the movie is sci-fi.

I personally think it will be a better film as a result

So yes, it will be better :P Effects will be much better too.
